survey.title: Voice and Depression Questionnaire
survey.description: This survey is designed for participants in the MIT Voice and Depression study.
survey.submitText: Done! Thanks for participating. Please join again soon.

message.messageText: These questions are about your experiences in the last two weeks. In answering these questions, think about the past two weeks.

prompt.displayLabel: Little interest or pleasure in doing things
prompt.promptText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by little interest or pleasure in doing things?
prompt.abbreviatedText: Little interest or pleasure in doing things

property.label: Not at all
Several days
More than half the days
Nearly every day

prompt.promptText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?

property.label: Not at all
Several days
More than half the days
Nearly every day

prompt.displayLabel: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
prompt.promptText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
prompt.abbreviatedText: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much

property.label: Not at all
Several days
More than half the days
Nearly every day

prompt.displayLabel: Feeling tired or having little energy
prompt.promptText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by feeling tired or having little energy?
prompt.abbreviatedText: Feeling tired or having little energy

property.label: Not at all
Several days
More than half the days
Nearly every day

prompt.promptText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by poor appetite or overeating?

property.label: Not at all
Several days
More than half the days
Nearly every day

prompt.displayLabel: Feeling bad about yourself — or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
prompt.promptText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by feeling bad about yourself — or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down?
prompt.abbreviatedText: Feeling bad about yourself — or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down

property.label: Not at all
Several days
More than half the days
Nearly every day

prompt.displayLabel: Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
prompt.promptText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television?
prompt.abbreviatedText: Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television

property.label: Not at all
Several days
More than half the days
Nearly every day

prompt.displayLabel: Moving or speaking slowly or rapidly
prompt.promptText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite — being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual?
prompt.abbreviatedText: Moving or speaking slowly or rapidly

property.label: Not at all
Several days
More than half the days
Nearly every day

message.messageText: These questions are about your experiences in the last week. In answering these questions, think about the past seven days.

prompt.displayLabel: How quickly do you fall asleep?
prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, how quickly have you fallen asleep?
prompt.abbreviatedText: How quickly do you fall asleep?

property.label: I never take longer than 30 minutes to fall asleep.
I take at least 30 minutes to fall asleep, less than half the time.
I take at least 30 minutes to fall asleep, more than half the time.
I take more than 60 minutes to fall asleep, more than half the time.

prompt.displayLabel: Do you wake during the night?
prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, have you woken up during the night?

property.label: I do not wake up at night.
I have a restless, light sleep with a few brief awakenings each night.
I wake up at least once a night, but I go back to sleep easily.
I awaken more than once a night and stay awake for 20 minutes or more, more than half the time.

prompt.promptText: When do you wake up?

property.label: Most of the time, I awaken no more than 30 minutes before I need to get up.
More than half the time, I awaken more than 30 minutes before I need to get up.
I almost always awaken at least one hour or so before I need to, but I go back to sleep eventually.
I awaken at least one hour before I need to, and can't go back to sleep.

prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, how much have you slept?

property.label: I sleep no longer than 7-8 hours/night, without napping during the day.
I sleep no longer than 10 hours in a 24-hour period including naps.
I sleep no longer than 12 hours in a 24-hour period including naps.
I sleep longer than 12 hours in a 24-hour period including naps.

prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, have you felt sad?

property.label: I do not feel sad.
I feel sad less than half the time.
I feel sad more than half the time.
I feel sad nearly all the time.

prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, has your appetite been different?

property.label: My appetite is decreased.
My appetite is the same.
My appetite is increased.

prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, how has your appetite decreased?

property.label: I eat somewhat less often or lesser amounts of food than usual.
I eat much less than usual and only with personal effort.
I rarely eat within a 24-hour period, and only with extreme personal effort or when others persuade me to eat.

prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, how has your appetite increased?

property.label: I feel a need to eat more frequently than usual.
I regularly eat more often and/or greater amounts of food than usual.
I feel driven to overeat both at mealtime and between meals.

prompt.promptText: During the past TWO WEEKS, has your weight changed?

property.label: My weight has decreased.
My weight is the same.
My weight has increased.

prompt.promptText: During the past TWO WEEKS, how has your weight decreased?

property.label: I feel as if I have had a slight weight loss.
I have lost 2 pounds or more.
I have lost 5 pounds or more.

prompt.promptText: During the past TWO WEEKS, how has your appetite increased?

property.label: I feel a need to eat more frequently than usual.
I regularly eat more often and/or greater amounts of food than usual.
I feel driven to overeat both at mealtime and between meals.

prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, have there been changes in your concentration or ability to make decisions?

property.label: There is no change in my usual capacity to concentrate or make decisions.
I occasionally feel indecisive or find that my attention wanders.
Most of the time, I struggle to focus my attention or to make decisions.
I cannot concentrate well enough to read or cannot make even minor decisions.

prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, how have you viewed yourself?

property.label: I see myself as equally worthwhile and deserving as other people.
I am more self-blaming than usual.
I largely believe that I cause problems for others.
I think almost constantly about major and minor defects in myself.

prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, what’s been your level of interest in things?

property.label: There is no change from usual in how interested I am in other people or activities.
I notice that I am less interested in people or activities.
I find I have interest in only one or two of my formerly pursued activities.
I have virtually no interest in formerly pursued activities.

prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, what’s been your level of energy?

property.label: There is no change in my usual level of energy.
I get tired more easily than usual.
I have to make a big effort to start or finish my usual daily activities (for example, shopping, homework, cooking, or going to work).
I really cannot carry out most of my usual daily activities because I just don't have the energy.

prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, have you felt slowed down?

property.label: I think, speak, and move at my usual rate of speed.
I find that my thinking is slowed down or my voice sounds dull or flat.
It takes me several seconds to respond to most questions and I'm sure my thinking is slowed.
I am often unable to respond to questions without extreme effort.

prompt.promptText: During the past seven days, have you felt restless?

property.label: I do not feel restless.
I'm often fidgety, wringing my hands, or need to shift how I am sitting.
I have impulses to move about and am quite restless.
At times, I am unable to stay seated and need to pace around.

prompt.promptText: How do you feel about the sound of your voice?

property.label: strongly dislike
somewhat dislike
neutral/no feeling
somewhat like
strongly like

prompt.promptText: Why do you dislike your voice?

property.label: pitch
speaking rate/speed
difficulty conveying emotions

prompt.promptText: Why do you like most about your voice?

property.label: pitch
speaking rate/speed
ability to convey emotions

prompt.promptText: Are you currently in a quiet location where you won’t be interrupted and can speak out loud?

property.label: Yes
No

message.messageText: Please move to a quiet environment where you are able to focus on the questions and speak out loud.

prompt.promptText: Take a picture of what's in front of you.

message.messageText: Please make sure you’re in a quiet location where you can speak out loud. The next few questions will ask you to say certain things. Don’t forget to hit “record”!

prompt.promptText: Make an audio recording of what's going on around you.
Count from 1 to 20.
Say the letters of the alphabet.
Say “pa-ta-ka” five times fast.
Say “pa-ta-ka” carefully, as if talking with someone who has trouble understanding you.
Please say the vowel "ee" as in "feed" and hold it for 5 seconds.
Please say the vowel "ae" as in "bat" and hold it for 5 seconds.
Please say the vowel "ah" as in "father" and hold it for 5 seconds.
Please say the vowel "ooh" as in "boot" and hold it for 5 seconds.
Read this phrase (it's OK if you mess up - keep recording!): "Pad kid poured curd pulled cold."
Say the phrase "good morning" as if you were greeting a friend.
Say the phrase "good morning?" as if you were asking a friend about their morning.
Please read this passage out loud: “When the sunlight strikes raindrops in the air, they act like a prism and form a rainbow. A rainbow is the division of white light into many beautiful colors.”
Please read this passage out loud: “These take the shape of a large, round arch, with its path high above and its two ends apparently beyond the horizon.”
Please read this passage out loud: “There is, according to legend, a boiling pot of gold at one end. People look but no one ever finds it.”
Please read this passage out loud: “When a man looks for something beyond his reach, his friends say he is looking for the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow.”
Please read this passage out loud: "Do you like amusement parks? Well, I sure do. To amuse myself, I went twice last spring."
Please read this passage out loud: "My most MEMORABLE moment was riding on the Caterpillar, which is a gigantic rollercoaster high above the ground."

Please read this passage out loud: "When I saw how high the Caterpillar rose into the bright blue sky I knew it was for me. After waiting in line for thirty minutes, I made it to the front where the man measured my height to see if I was tall enough."
Please read this passage out loud: "I gave the man my coins, asked for change, and jumped on the cart. Tick, tick, tick, the Caterpillar climbed slowly up the tracks."
Please read this passage out loud: "It went SO high I could see the parking lot. Boy was I SCARED! I thought to myself, “There’s no turning back now.”"
Please read this passage out loud: "People were so scared they screamed as we swiftly zoomed fast, fast, and faster along the tracks. As quickly as it started, the Caterpillar came to a stop."
Please read this passage out loud: "Unfortunately, it was time to pack the car and drive home. That night I dreamt of the wild ride on the Caterpillar."
Please read this passage out loud: "Taking a trip to the amusement park and riding on the Caterpillar was my MOST memorable moment ever!"

Please read this passage out loud: "You wished to know all about my grandfather. Well, he is nearly 93 years old; he dresses himself in an ancient black frock coat, usually minus several buttons; yet he still thinks as swiftly as ever."

Please read this passage out loud: "A long, flowing beard clings to his chin, giving those who observe him a pronounced feeling of the utmost respect. When he speaks, his voice is just a bit cracked and quivers a trifle."

Please read this passage out loud: "Twice each day he plays skilfully and with zest upon our small organ. Except in the winter when the ooze or snow or ice prevents, he slowly takes a short walk in the open air each day."
Please read this passage out loud: "We have often urged him to walk more and smoke less, but he always answers, “Banana oil!” Grandfather likes to be modern in his language."
Please read this passage out loud: "The birch canoe slid on the smooth planks."
Please read this passage out loud: "Glue the sheet to the dark blue background."
Please read this passage out loud: "It's easy to tell the depth of a well."
Please read this passage out loud: "These days a chicken leg is a rare dish."
Please read this passage out loud: "Rice is often served in round bowls."
Please read this passage out loud: "The juice of lemons makes fine punch."
Please read this passage out loud: "The box was thrown beside the parked truck."
Please read this passage out loud: "The hogs were fed chopped corn and garbage."
Please read this passage out loud: "Four hours of steady work faced us."
Please read this passage out loud: "Large size in stockings is hard to sell."
Please read this passage out loud: "I really enjoy our family vacations"
Please read this passage out loud: "We had so much fun last night"
Please read this passage out loud: "You look so excited"
Please read this passage out loud: "What could be better?"
Please read this passage out loud: "I love spending time with you"
Please read this passage out loud: "This chicken is excellent"
Please read this passage out loud: "The new version is the best"
Please read this passage out loud: "That show makes me laugh"
Please read this passage out loud: "That magazine is my favorite"
Please read this passage out loud: "I always enjoy when she visits"
Please read this passage out loud: "That was better than the first time"
Please read this passage out loud: "You look wonderful"
Please read this passage out loud: "What joke could be funnier than that?"
Please read this passage out loud: "That was a blast"
Please read this passage out loud: "I highly recommend that professor"
Please read this passage out loud: "Isn’t that beautiful?"
Please read this passage out loud: "He’s always pleasant to be around"
Please read this passage out loud: "I look forward to meeting you"
Please read this passage out loud: "The soup is delicious"
Please read this passage out loud: "The mountains are supposed to be nice this time of year"
Please read this passage out loud: "The atmosphere there is very nice"
Please read this passage out loud: "I can’t wait to see you"
Please read this passage out loud: "I would definitely like another slice"
Please read this passage out loud: "Have you ever tasted anything better?"
What's your favorite memory from school growing up?
What's your least favorite memory from school growing up?

prompt.displayLabel: Favorite memory from the last week
prompt.promptText: What's your favorite memory from the last week?
prompt.abbreviatedText: Favorite memory from the last week

prompt.displayLabel: Least favorite memory from the last week
prompt.promptText: What's your least favorite memory from the last week?
prompt.abbreviatedText: Least favorite memory from the last week

prompt.promptText: What’s the best thing that happened in your life today? What made it so good?
What’s the worst thing that happened in your life today? What made it so bad?
What’s your favorite movie? What do you like about it?
What’s your least favorite movie? What don't you like about it?
How are you feeling today?
How do you feel about tomorrow? Excited? Bored? Nervous? Anything in particular causing those feelings?
Describe a memorable event that happened to you yesterday.
Describe the environment you're currently in. What stands out to you?
Did you have any pets growing up? If yes, describe one. If not, did you want one? What kind?
